channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024071342
item.description:
Report X-2024071342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: BLAUVELT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 7/16 at 6am, the ops supervisor alerted the quality assurance team of a damaged hazmat. This was located on the vanline by the first work area. Upon inspection by QA, there was a noticeable leakage due to a loose cap causing the outer packaging to be completely wet.

item.title: Report E-2024070486
item.description:
Report E-2024070486

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While moving freight across the dock forklift operator did not realize the forkblades from their forklift were sticking out from the pallet they were carrying and as a result the protruding forkblades hit and punctured a drum already staged on the dock consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO CALL, DONNED GOGGLES BOOTS APRON AND GLOVES. USED ZEP ZORBANT TO CLEAN UP SPILL, PLACED IN SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT BACK TO DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING. RESPONDER FOLLOWED WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND DECON CHECKLIST.

item.title: Report E-2024070421
item.description:
Report E-2024070421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a forklift puncture. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet and deployed oil dri and soda ash to the impacted area. The damaged boxes, jugs and recovered material were placed into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024070331
item.description:
Report E-2024070331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XRC experienced a UN3378 GreenClean Pro release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bag, released product, and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
